meanings.definition: Eager or quick to argue or fight
meanings.sent1: She spoke truculently whenever someone disagreed with her.
meanings.sent2: The dog growled truculently at the stranger approaching the house.
meanings.sent3: The toddler truculently insisted on having the blue toy instead of the red one.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered truculently on the horizon, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: His truculently competitive nature made him a formidable opponent in the game.

meanings.sent1: The teacher scolded the truculently disobedient student in front of the class.
meanings.sent2: The protestors marched truculently, demanding justice for their cause.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat truculently in the middle of the doorway, refusing to move.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood truculently against the harsh winds, its walls weathered but unyielding.
meanings.sent5: Her truculently stubborn attitude often led to conflicts with her peers.
